title.narrative: Recovery and Reintegration Support for Bangladeshi Returnee Migrant Workers (bridging)

description.narrative:
By combining short-term and long-term support for survivors of abuse and exploitation across 8 districts in Bangladesh, with advocacy activities to improve Government-provided services, this project will aim to reduce risky remigration by vulnerable migrants workers and survivors of exploitation and abuse through recovery, reintegration, and economic support when they return to Bangladesh. The project will directly follow the 25 month project 'Recovery and Reintegration Support for Bangladeshi Returnee Migrant Workers' to allow support and activities to continue while further funding is explored. The project is a consortium with CAFOD as the lead agency providing capacity strengthening to its partners, Caritas Bangladesh leading activities providing sustainable employment options and start up businesses for survivors, and OKUP providing access to shelter, psychosocial counselling, medical referrals, legal aid, family reunification and dispute resolution. The project will also work with the Bangladesh Government to advocate for improved reintegration services, especially for the most vulnerable women returnee migrant workers.
The 25 month project was funded by the Global Fund to End Modern Slavery (GFEMS), with this 9 more bridging period being funded by CAFOD. Caritas Bangladesh bridging period is for 9 months and OKUP's bridging period is for 6 months. The bridging period will focus on sustainability of the project, including supporting returnee migrants to find jobs, providing life skills training, cluster meetings to discuss business progress and referring cases to service providers.
